info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Park County through 330 PM MDT... At 300 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southwest of Livingston, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Chico Hot Springs, Pine Creek, Chico and Emigrant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for south central Montana.
